item.title: Sony Announces Helldivers And Horizon Zero Dawn Movies
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/helldivers-2-horizon-zero-dawn-movie-ghost-tsushima-1851733809

Sony has big Hollywood plans for its hit gaming franchises. The PlayStation 5 maker announced a series of new movie spin-offs at CES 2025 this week, including movie versions of Helldivers 2 and Horizon Zero Dawn, as well as an anime spin-off of Ghost of Tsushima.

Suggested Reading

The Week In Games: Co-Op Bug Blasting And More New Releases

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

Horizon Zero Dawn, a game about fighting giant robotic monsters that have taken over earth, will be brought to the big screen through a partnership between PlayStation Productions and Columbia Pictures, Sony announced onstage at its CES press conference on Monday. The Helldivers adaptation, meanwhile, will be made by Sony Pictures. Neither has a projected release date yet, which makes sense at least in Helldivers’ case. No one expected it to be such a big hit just a year ago. 

Of course, Helldivers 2, a militaristic parody of a futuristic fascist empire fighting off alien invaders, is sort of already a movie. It’s called Starship Troopers, the Paul Verhoeven action comedy based on the sci-fi novel by Robert Heinlein. Then again, this wouldn’t be the first time Sony made a movie from a game that’s loosely inspired by another movie. That is, after all, effectively what the Uncharted adaptation was, which starred Tom Holland as the Indiana Jones-esque treasure hunter Nathan Drake.

Sony also revealed that Ghost of Tsushima will be getting an anime series called Legends. It’s being made for the streaming service Crunchyroll by Aniplex, the studio behind Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba, and directed by Takanobu Mizuno, known for Star Wars: Visions -“The Duel.” It’s a ways off, though, as Ghost of Tsushima: Legends isn’t set to release until 2027. In the meantime, the 2020 game’s sequel, Ghost of Yotei, is set to arrive on PS5 late this year.

.

item.title: HBO's The Last Of Us Season 2 Gets New Trailer And Surprise April Release Date
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/hbo-last-of-us-season-2-part-ii-trailer-joel-ellie-ces-1851733793

HBO’s adaptation of The Last of Us returns for season 2 in just a few months. Sony revealed the hit horror game will be back on TV with fresh episodes beginning in April and dropped a new trailer for fans to pore over in the meantime.

Suggested Reading

Spider-Man 2's New Web Wings Make It Feel Like A Proper Sequel

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

The Last of Us season 2's April 2025 release was announced tonight during Sony’s press conference at CES 2025. It was an odd place to drop blockbuster entertainment news, but fans of Naughty Dog’s post-apocalyptic series ultimately won’t care. They now have a new 60-second trailer full of short references to pivotal moments in the games.

Take a look:

The first season of The Last of Us debuted on HBO back in 2023. It covers the events of the first game, originally released for PlayStation 3 a decade prior, with the events of The Last of Us Part II largely expected to be divided between season 2 and a future season 3.

Starring Pedro Pascal as Joel and Bella Ramsey as Ellie, the show follows a surrogate father-daughter pair as they navigate the violent vestiges of humanity after a deadly disease wipes out society as we know it. Guided by showrunners Craig Mazin, best known for the mini-series Chernobyl, and Neil Druckmann, the lead writer and director of the games, HBO’s adaptation ended up being one of 2023's hit shows, proving games could be good fodder for prestige TV under the right circumstances.

The Last of Us is now spearheading Sony’s game-to-TV-and-movie pipeline, with Helldivers, Horizon Zero Dawn, and Ghost of Tsushima all getting various spin-offs in the next few years. A God of War series is also in development, though its timeline remains up in the air following recent departures from the writing and directing teams.

item.title: The Sonic Movies Have Now Made Over A Billion Dollars
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/sonic-3-live-action-sega-movie-1-billion-box-office-1851733653

Sonic the Hedgehog 3 hit theaters late last month and has already grossed more than $300 million worldwide, pushing the film series based on Sega’s popular video games past the one-billion mark and making it one of Paramount’s biggest ongoing franchises.

Suggested Reading

The Top 10 Most-Played Games On Steam Deck: August 2023 Edition

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

On January 5, Paramount Pictures put out a press release confirming that the live-action Sonic the Hedgehog film franchise has now made over $1 billion at the box office. That means it’s made more than Halloween, Paranormal Activity, and A Quiet Place.

For Paramount, Sonic has become a very important franchise at a time when the studio has struggled to squeeze massive blockbusters out of past winners, like Transformers and Star Trek. So it’s not shocking that as Sonic crosses the 1-billion-dollar mark, Paramount is already working on a sequel. The next movie is reportedly arriving in 2027.

“The Sonic the Hedgehog franchise has become an unstoppable cultural force with limitless potential,” said Paramount Pictures President & CEO Brian Robbins. “Congratulations to our partners at SEGA, our filmmaking team...who have revolutionized the heights that Sonic can reach, and the legions of loyal and devoted fans who have helped guide us every step of the way.”

It feels like a lifetime ago when the first Sonic the Hedgehog film teaser hit the web and we all got to see that original, ugly CG Sonic that was so monstrous, fans backlashed hard enough to force Paramount and Sega to change the character’s look into something less awful. That first film ended up making $319 million at the box office.

In 2022, Sonic 2 hit theaters, receiving better reviews and making over $400 million. There was a Knuckles spin-off TV show in early 2024, but nobody talks about that. Then finally, in December, Paramount released Sonic the Hedgehog 3, which is one of the highest-rated video game movies in history and has already made more money than the first film in just about two weeks. Pretty good for a hedgehog that runs really fast.

.

item.title: Everything Coming In Marvel Rivals’ Fantastic Four-Focused Season
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/marvel-rivals-season-1-fantastic-four-patch-notes-map-1851733602

Marvel Rivals is entering its second season, confusingly named Season 1 because the first one was Season 0, and it’s bringing four new heroes to the game all at once. The Fantastic Four are joining the roster. Mister Fantastic and Invisible Woman will join on January 10, seemingly alongside a new map, a balance patch, and a battle pass. The other two will join in the latter half of the season. Developer NetEase is rolling out information on Season 1: Eternal Night Falls throughout the week, so we’ll be updating this post with new details as they come. Here’s everything we know so far about Marvel Rivals’ Fantastic Four-focused season.

Suggested Reading

Live Forever in the Universe of 'New World: Aeternum'

Suggested Reading

The Fantastic Four join the fight

Headlining the season are the Fantastic Four, with Mister Fantastic, The Thing, Invisible Woman, and Human Torch all joining the roster. Mister Fantastic and Human Torch appear to be damage-dealing Duelists, with The Thing being a tanky Vanguard and Invisible Woman rounding out the team as a supporting Strategist. The first trailer for the season introduces all four heroes in a version of New York City plunged into an “eternal night” by Dracula. Marvel Rivals takes place in a multiverse-spanning battle between two versions of the Fantastic Four villain Doctor Doom, each fighting for control of all the timelines, and this season one of them has teamed up with Dracula, resulting in vampiric monsters overrunning NYC. Or, as NetEase’s official synopsis puts it:

Darkness engulfs New York as the Timestream Entanglement leaves Doctor Strange trapped in the Entangled Astral Plane, scattering the Darkhold pages. Dracula and Doctor Doom disrupt the moon’s orbit, plunging the city into eternal night and unleashing an army of vampiric creatures.

What else is coming in Season 1 of Marvel Rivals?

Right now all NetEase has officially revealed is the Fantastic Four, so we’ll have more information on any upcoming balance changes and the new battle pass as we get closer to the release date. NetEase has confirmed Season 1 will launch on January 10 at 1 a.m. Pacific Time/4 a.m. Eastern Time, so check back between now and then for any more information as we get it.
